job_title: ICU Registered Nurse in New Smyrna Beach, FL
pros: My co workers as a bedside RN in ICU are nothing short of exceptional. They are the very definition of teamwork, peer support, committed to a standard of excellence and have given me a level of comradery and support that I never experienced in any other hospital. Having been an ICU RN for the last 32 years, this statement carries significant weight and I hold by every word! I also cannot say enough about how appreciative I am to the ICU unit manager Yvonne for her continual support, kindness and perseverance. She walked into a physically, emotionally and psychologically struggling unit and dove right in to help everyone out. I am forever grateful for her support.
cons: Communication from day to day activities, to information from upper management, continues to be a large problem and has not improved over the years I've worked here. We now have a lens board ( when it works) but the same issues continue to be brought up and not addressed by the management team beyond our unit manager. Our unit manager can only do so much; it is then up to upper management to make decisions that support the unit and supply what is needed whether it be staff, etc. Unfortunately, there also seems to be no regard for employee retention. It appears that the hospital would rather hire in new employees with less experience than to continue to invest in those who have stayed loyal to the company over the years. Sending around an ice cream cart every once in a while is not productive in keeping skilled, experienced, exceptional workers; it generally makes the staff feel devalued and disrespected. There also continues to be a perception that although ICU takes care of the most critical patients in the hospital they need, and deserve, the least assistance in staffing and other areas. There seems to be no consideration of how critically ill these patients are and how much care they require; care that is specialized due to their critical status. The patients and community we serve deserve so much more as well as the staff. I believe that the healing ministry of Christ is more than prayer over the com system. It involves valuing people, meeting them where they are at and lifting them up. This does not seem to extend to the staff as well. It should.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Smyrna, FL
pros: Benefits available other than revised PDO benefit.
cons: PDO pay outs take 25% away of 100% earned income -  O/T policy for night shift cutting off at midnight after or weekly hrs exceeded 40  is unfair, we do not leave at midnight therefore O/T should continue until we actually end our shift. Instead goes to back to straight time onto next period which has resulted in loss of worked overtime pay for me on several occasion's. - 3rd shift differential was to be grandfathered in to Bert Fish long time employees  yet we where cut to 2nd shift pay until after 11pm. shortly after takeover.  These changes reduced my yearly income by thousands and after over 10yrs of loyal work it's disappointing.

review_title: Love my current job - some areas need serious help

review_title: Don't expect fairness unless you play the politics game
job_title: Pool in New Smyrna Beach, FL
pros: Enjoyed the work and the majority of co workers.
cons: Bosses treat some people special and some people not special. You have to kiss up to get "fair". Get in a clique fast or it'll be harder for you. ZERO work/life balance. None. They don't care if you pass out during your shift. And don't try to call management out on lies, even if you have emails as proof, or go to HR. HR doesn't give a flying you know what about you, because they're friends with management.
